news_header: ByteDance, the owner of TikTok, has fired an intern for interfering with its AI model training but denied claims of significant damage.
news_text: ByteDance announced the termination of an intern from its advertising technology team for 'maliciously interfering' with the training of one of its AI models. The company refuted claims regarding the extent of the damage, stating that reports contained exaggerations and inaccuracies. The intern, who lacked experience with the AI Lab, reportedly did not impact ByteDance's commercial operations, including its large language AI models. ByteDance also dismissed allegations of over $10 million in damages and communicated the incident to the intern's university and industry bodies. The company continues to invest in AI technologies for its popular apps like TikTok and Douyin.
